paper_title.en: Formulation of the influence of the density and the stress path dependency of plastic flow in sand

description.en: A kinematic hardening model for sand, which has been named kinematic t(ij)-sand model, is extended to simulate the behavior of sand under different densities and under cyclic loading in general stress systems. The influence of the density and the confining pressure is taken into consideration by introducing a variable d and referring the subloading surface concept. Furthermore, the evolution rule of the center of the yield surface is improved to describe the influence of the stress path history on plastic flow precisely. The validity of the extended model is confirmed by triaxial tests and true triaxial tests on Toyoura sand.

paper_title.en: Formulation of the influence of the density and the stress path dependency of plastic flow in sand

description.en: A kinematic hardening model for sand, which has been named kinematic t(ij)-sand model, is extended to simulate the behavior of sand under different densities and under cyclic loading in general stress systems. The influence of the density and the confining pressure is taken into consideration by introducing a variable d and referring the subloading surface concept. Furthermore, the evolution rule of the center of the yield surface is improved to describe the influence of the stress path history on plastic flow precisely. The validity of the extended model is confirmed by triaxial tests and true triaxial tests on Toyoura sand.

paper_title.en: Earth pressure and ground movements due to tunneling - model tests and analyses
Model tests of tunneling in sandy and clayey groundds with different construction procedure
Shear behavior of sand under monotonic and cyclic loadings and its elastoplastic modeling.
Effects of excavation sequence on the 3-D settlement of shallow tunnels

description.en: A new device is proposed to test the influence of the excavation sequence of tunnel construction using laboratory models. The apparatus consists of a series of horizontal bars, which can slide independently along the tunnel lining. In this way known displacements are imposed around the excavation contour. A series of tests are performed with this device using Toyoura sand to model the ground. The experimental results are checked against a simpler trap door experiment. Three-dimensional numerical simulations in conditions similar to the proposed test are also performed, using a finite element code to which the tii-sand model was incorporated. The numerical results can qualitatively reproduce most of the observed displacement patterns.

publication_name.en: GEOTECHNICAL ASPECTS OF UNDERGROUND CONSTRUCTION IN SOFT GROUND
